intro: Gnaphalium adnatum, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowering period occurs in spring and summer, producing tiny yellow flowers that are often overlooked. Gnaphalium adnatum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Australian herbal remedies.
